items.title: Ladakh & Turtuk, India - A Travel Diary
items.summary: Turtuk, the last village of India. Situated right on the Pakistan-India border, turtuk is a very less explored destination (and…
items.content_html: Turtuk, the last village of India. Situated right on the Pakistan-India border, turtuk is a very less explored destination (and maybe why still so beautiful without a sight of plastic litter). Vehicles are prohibited beyond a point and there's only a bridge connecting people of Turtuk to the other side. These girls wanted some chocolates. We bought them and I got a chance to capture their happiness. And their home!

items.title: About Magica
items.summary: Planning your dream wedding? Let us make it magical for you. From exotic destination weddings to absolute private weddings, we…
items.content_html:
Planning your dream wedding? Let us make it magical for you. From exotic destination weddings to absolute private weddings, we shoot and film everything. You give us your story, we'll make sure it's preserved as ever lasting memories.

¬†
Wedding photography which speaks emotions. Every tiny story from your wedding day beautifully captured in well-thought frames and presented to re-live those at any point in time.

Photography is my Passion.

My name is Rish and nearly a decade ago, I quit my corporate job to follow my passion for telling stories through photography.

I founded Magica for documenting amazing stories of people. Stories that move your heart.

Stories that deserve to be told. Stories on film & photos. Over the years, we‚Äôve worked with amazing people across the globe, been part of the biggest days of their lives and made everlasting memories for them. We look forward to creating some for you too!

Follow me on Instagram

items.title: Ansh & Nitika - The Wedding
Kartik & Preetika - Pre Wedding
items.summary: The day started somewhere around afternoon. Like everyone else, K & P were very camera conscious. Beautiful locations and faces…
items.content_html:
The day started somewhere around afternoon. Like everyone else, K & P were very camera conscious. Beautiful locations and faces aside, I was in no way going to get the emotions, had that been the case for too long. So I decided something. I risked the time and the effect it was having on the light around & I put my camera down. I tried to make them comfortable and assure Kartik that he doesn‚Äôt have to worry about how he‚Äôs looking in the photographs. It took me around 2 hours to get them into the ‚Äúzone‚Äù. But it was all worth it!

And then the graph of amazing pictures grew exponentially

So that was Day 1. I started with two very difficult to work with people, put in *a lot* of effort to get them into the zone and ultimately had the photographs I was happy with. That last thing has to happen at the end of every shoot and I‚Äôm glad it did with the Day 1.

Next comes the Day 2. We decided to keep it the more lively, brighter kind of day. So we chose things accordingly. From places to props, from attires to expressions, everything had to scream LIFE!

And the lady luck was on our side as well. We found this beautiful location to shoot with, just around the evening.

And those were Kartik & Preetika.

items.title: Sneha & Dhruva - A Kanpur Wedding Story
items.summary: Sneha and Dhruva‚Äôs story goes back to the college days where the days went with being together and late nights…
items.content_html:
Sneha and Dhruva‚Äôs story goes back to the college days where the days went with being together and late nights for sorting the fights between them¬†üôÇ¬†Both being great friends and the members of¬†Saurabh‚Äòs gang, were miles apart in nature. But still, love found its way like it always does. The moment their wedding date got finalized, I was called to photograph their journey and story from Delhi to Kanpur. Both being friends of¬†Saurabh & Deeksha, I wasn‚Äôt asked, but informed that I‚Äôm shooting their wedding¬†üòõ¬†And I obliged! Let me take you to Sneha‚Äôs home in Kanpur where I was pretty excited, seeing the environment and the energy that surrounded her morning rituals. This is as simple and emotionally colorful as it can get!

After everyone was done with the initial rituals, Sneha was supposed to be taken to the nearby temple. If you haven‚Äôt been to Kanpur and especially in the streets of the town, you wouldn‚Äôt know that they are actually very emaciated. That said, there were numerous shops all around with kids running all over the street. That made me excited about the photo-making possibilites there.

And while they were moving forward, I was actually moving backwards, photographing them. While I have mastered the art of making photographs walking in opposite direction over the years, the streets of Kanpur were a challenge. However, the colors, the patterns and the opportunities around seemed endless to my eyes!

And this being probably the most interesting rituals ever, Sneha‚Äôs brother was to pour water on her head through the pictured arrangement. Now I‚Äôm not sure what exactly that signified but I saw the childhood revenges getting justified¬†üòõ

Sneha‚Äôs brother probably went a little over the board and wanted to finish it off by pouring all the water. Everyone else was trying to stop him though¬†üòÄ

And it was time for some portraits! I couldn‚Äôt have missed taking the portraits among the interesting streets, colors, patterns of this beautiful bride to be!

The afternoon ended with the lunch and now it was time for the wedding. I arrived at the venue much before time since I wanted to shoot Dhruva‚Äôs enthusiasm from the very beginning!

And it all started when the friendly gang arrived!

Not sure about everyone else, but the band-lead was sure having a great time¬†üòõ

I seem to have some weird special relationship with rain. A minute before everything was fine and a second after, it started pouring. However, that didn‚Äôt‚Äô deter these guys even a bit from dancing in their best friend‚Äôs wedding!

Saurabh is returning the favor from his own wedding!

And amidst all the rain, chaos and madness, Sneha arrived.

I wish I could‚Äôve put sound in this picture¬†üòÄ

And that was Sneha & Dhruva‚Äôs wedding from Kanpur. Unfortunately, I wasn‚Äôt able to cover the full wedding because of the delays and the fact that all their friends and I had return tickets booked from there but nevertheless, I enjoyed every bit of their wedding & tried to put all the love and emotions I felt there in these photographs. Thank You, Dhruva and Sneha for letting me be a part of your wedding! Ending the post with Ria‚Äôs photograph which was the last one I made, just before stepping out of the train at New Delhi¬†üôÇ

items.title: Wedding Films
A Suryagarh Palace Destination Wedding - Day 2
items.summary: Welcome to the second day of Jasmin & Mayank‚Äôs destination wedding in Jaisalmer. We got over with the fun filled¬†Day…
items.content_html:
Welcome to the second day of Jasmin & Mayank‚Äôs destination wedding in Jaisalmer. We got over with the fun filled¬†Day 1¬†and the next day came sooner than I expected. An early morning call woke me up and I was off to photograph the first event of the morning.

The morning started with the chuda ceremony of Jasmin. ¬†

The sun had just risen and the wedding venue was being set up.

While I had the time to get some cool lehenga shots with the backdrop of this colossal palace!

And it was time for the bride to get ready!

Jasmin put a surprize element in Mayank‚Äôs sherwani which was the pic of their late maternal granny. She has been very important to them and they wanted her to be the part of their wedding in some way¬†üôÇ

Meanwhile Mayank was getting ready as well

Mayank, the groom!

But of course, Jasmin was taking a little long in getting ready¬†üòÄ

And there she was, the show-stopper!

And while Jamsmin got ready, the folks outside were already dancing with the baarat

The palace backdrop gave every picture the feel of a painting!

And Mayank cleverly dodged his mother-in-law‚Äôs welcome¬†üòÄ

Alongside this beautiful venue in the middle of a pool, Jasmine was just waiting to be escorted.

The look in Mayank‚Äôs eyes explains everything

And they both exchanged the wedding vows.

Soon after the commencement of Hindu wedding ceremony, everyone was headed to the Gurdwarafor their Sikh tradition wedding.

And that was Jasmin & Mayank‚Äôs beautiful, fun & amazing destination wedding in Jaisalmer, India. It wasn‚Äôt just a wedding. It was an experience in itself.

items.title: A Suryagarh Palace Destination Wedding Day 1
items.summary: Jaisalmer. What comes to your mind when you hear this name? A city built along the Thar Desert, Jaisalmer is…
items.content_html:
Jaisalmer. What comes to your mind when you hear this name? A city built along the Thar Desert, Jaisalmer is one of India‚Äôs most beautiful cities filled with history, tradition, and palaces. A perfect destination for Indian Weddings as well. Jasmin & Mayank got in touch with me earlier this year for their wedding. Going around deciding on the venues between New Delhi and Jaisalmer, I found myself at Suryagarh Palace some months later to shoot their magnificent wedding story. Let me take you for a ride!

Jaisalmer welcomed with all its warmth after a 14 hour train journey from New Delhi. Apart from the city, the families of Jasmin and Mayank welcomed people with the same warmth. And soon it was time for a little ceremony that involved Mayank.

Under the afternoon sun, there were all happy faces

With smirk & sprinkles of playful games, this was a very very fun ceremony

Meanwhile, the stage was being set up for the evening event.

And the weather gods seemed to play some hide and seek

¬† And the weather gods seemed to play some hide and seek

Everyone was ready for the haldi ceremony

With Jasmin‚Äôs dad setting up rules that everyone has to participate in singing songs and applying haldi!

Meanwhile, cuteness overload happened¬†üôÇ

Just so that no-one can get away with ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt remember any songs‚Äù¬†üòõ

YAY!

With setting sun marking the end of the haldi, it was time to get ready for the evening sangeet!

If photographs could capture motion, this would‚Äôve had Jasmin‚Äôs dad dancing¬†üòÄ

‚ÄúFuture Mrs. Bhandari‚Äù

While Mayank was getting ready in adjacent room as well!

All check!

Walking along, I loved the look on their faces!

Let the dances begin!

And impromptu performance by Jasmin‚Äôs brother with his wife and daughter was absolutely amazing!

Mayank and Jasmin were¬†done sitting and watching¬†üòõ

And now it was friends‚Äô perfomance time!

The palace shined in the background!

While telling how badly they fought all their lives, Jamin‚Äôs brother couldn‚Äôt really fight his tears. That‚Äôs how all brother-sister relationships are, right?¬†üôÇ

And finally it was time for Jasmin‚Äôs dance!

And then everyone joined!

And that was the super fun-filled Day 1 of Jasmin & Mayank‚Äôs wedding. Day 2 is going to be filled with more awesomeness. Stay tuned!¬†üôÇ

items.title: Sarika & Krishan - Pre Wedding
items.summary: Owing to the nature of my profession, I have met so many cool people that I have lost the count…
items.content_html:
Owing to the nature of my profession, I have met so many cool people that I have lost the count long back. However, every now and then, ¬†that count keeps increasing. Sarika & Krishan were two people who not only increased that count but raised that bar of coolness. And they raised it really high to match. Having known Sarika for quite some years, I was super excited when she told me that she was going to get married to the love of her life, Krishan and I couldn‚Äôt wait to create memories for them. I did not, however, know Krishan and both were supposed to fly down from NYC to New Delhi to meet me. After 10 minutes of meeting Krishan, I was sure that this shoot was going to be one crazy one¬†üôÇ

Sarika & Krishan met during one of their meditation classes in NYC and went to different places after that. One thing lead to another and they soon found themselves enjoying talking over emails with each other. One fine day when they were in the same city, there were storms all over. They still decided to meet and God obliged. Suddenly and surprisingly it was all pleasant and calm and it became a walk to remember.

My job becomes so much easier when people are so much in love that it just shows¬†üôÇ

With love and light around, even simplest of things turn magical!

And now was the time to get real crazy. See the photograph below? You‚Äôd never believe what happened next.

This¬†üòÄ

So that was Sarika & Krishan. They are the kind of people who like to lie down on the ground and watch the stars. And that sums up everything.

items.title: The Roof-Top Wedding of Tricia & Hemant
items.summary: One fine day, a very well written email hit my inbox and a bride to be enquired about the possibility…
items.content_html:
One fine day, a very well written email hit my inbox and a bride to be enquired about the possibility of me shooting her very special and intimate 2-hour rooftop wedding at the Leela Palace, New Delhi. I instantly knew this was going to be worth it and she got a reply from me in 15 minutes. After couple of weeks of planning every single detail, it was indeed an affair to remember! Tricia, a PR professional and a lady with a flair of attention to details tied the knot with Hemant who happens to fly planes to make a living. Right from their wedding card to decor, everything was a stunning blend of taste and elegance. Let me take you to this picturesque wedding starting¬†

The day started early with Tricia getting ready.

To the venue which was draped in shades of white and gold.

And it was time to start the wedding ceremony.

A glimpse of the stunningly elegant mandap decor!

There were special corsages of roses for the bridesmaids too!

Clearly, weddings have some complex rituals¬†üòÄ

And Tricia and Hemant took blessings of the elders!

Lots of hugs and some tears

Meanwhile wishes came pouring in other ways as well!

¬† ¬† And that was Tricia & Hemant‚Äôs wedding. I‚Äôm so glad I was able to make memories for this amazing couple and I hope you felt what it was like to be at their wedding through these photos¬†üôÇ
